intro: Pternandra parasitica, commonly known as the parasitic pternandra, is a hemiparasitic plant that derives some of its nutrients from host plants. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant has small, simple leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its roots can penetrate the roots of host plants to extract water and minerals. It plays a role in ecological interactions by influencing the growth and distribution of its host species.
